source: If you enroll in a ZF medical plan, you have the option to add your legal spouse to coverage. If your spouse has medical coverage available through their employer, but does not enroll in it and is only covered by one of ZF’s medical plans, the spousal surcharge will apply.
The surcharge will be deducted in the following amounts based on your pay schedule:
The spousal surcharge will remain in place for the full plan year unless you experience a qualified life status event during the year which would allow the spousal surcharge to be removed.

If you enroll in a ZF medical plan, you must complete the Tobacco Surcharge attestation each year during Open Enrollment. You are considered a tobacco user if you are currently using nicotine or tobacco-based products such as cigarettes, cigars, pipes, e-cigarettes, vaping, snuff, chewing or dipping tobacco, snus, hookah, etc., in any amount. If you attest to being a nicotine or tobacco user, the tobacco surcharge will be applied.
The surcharge will be deducted in the following amounts based on your pay schedule:

The tobacco surcharge will remain in place for the full plan year. To have the surcharge stopped and refunded you must complete the 2Morrow tobacco cessation program. Participation in other tobacco cessation programs will not be accepted for the purposes of removing the tobacco surcharge.
If you have the tobacco surcharge applied due to not completing the tobacco user attestation during Open Enrollment, the tobacco surcharge cannot be stopped for the remainder of the year.
Is not eligible for coverage through his/her employer
Is enrolled in Medicare, a retiree or an
Is enrolled in both their employer’s medical plan and a ZF medical plan (ZF’s medical plan is secondary)

through Credence BCBS that supports an individual’s efforts to quit tobacco and nicotine use. If you attest to being a tobacco user and earn a 2Morrow Certificate of Completion between January 1 – October 31, 2024, the tobacco surcharge will be stopped and a refund for the amount withheld year-to-date will be processed.
If you enroll in a ZF medical plan, the Tobacco and Spousal Surcharge attestation(s) must be completed each year during Open Enrollment, or the surcharge(s) will automatically be applied.
An attestation screen will be shown after changing your
election using the medical benefit tile.
I have been smoke free for almost three months now! I’m soooo proud of myself! The journey has been difficult yet rewarding!
I breathe so much better now! My skin is
glowing as the blood circulation has made it back to my skin, food tastes better, and most importantly, hearing my 8 year old son tell me how proud he is of me for quitting!”
